page.title: 2009 attack on the Sri Lanka national cricket team

revision.comment: Reverted 2 edits by [[Special:Contributions/JunaidManzoorPk|JunaidManzoorPk]] ([[User talk:JunaidManzoorPk|talk]]) to last revision by Richard-of-Earth. ([[WP:TW|TW]])

{{weasel|date=March 2017}} {{Use British English|date=January 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2013}} {{Infobox civilian attack | title = 2009 attack on the [[Sri Lanka national cricket team]] in [[Pakistan]] | image = | caption = | location = [[Lahore]], [[Pakistan]] | coordinates = {{Coord|31|30|38|N|74|20|25|E|type:event|display=inline,title}} | date = {{start date|df=yes|2009|03|03}} | time = 08:40 [[Pakistan Standard Time|PKT]]{{Cite news|url=http://www.samaylive.com/news/pak-police-arrests-four-in-sri-lankan-team-attack/611844.html|title=Pak police arrests four in Sri Lankan team attack|date=3 Mar 2009 |publisher=samaylive|accessdate=2009-03-03|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090306214308/http://www.samaylive.com/news/pak-police-arrests-four-in-sri-lankan-team-attack/611844.html|archivedate=6 March 2009|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}} | timezone = [[UTC]]+5:00 | type = [[Ambush]] | fatalities = 6 Pakistani police officers
2 civilians | injuries = 6 [[List of Sri Lanka Test cricketers|Sri Lankan cricketers]] and 2 staff and 1 reserve umpire | perps = | perp = | Former susperps = | susperps = [[Lashkar-e-Jhangvi]],{{Cite news|url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2009\03\10\story_10-3-2009_pg1_7|title=Foreign hand behind attack on Sri Lankan team: Malik |date=10 March 2009|publisher=Daily times |accessdate=2009-03-27}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/Dawn%20Content%20Library/dawn/news/pakistan/suspects-at-liberty--bi |title=Suspects at Liberty |last=Rehman |first=Asha'ar |date=4 March 2009 |publisher=Dawn(Pakistani newspaper) |accessdate=2009-03-05 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{Cite news|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/top_story_detail.asp?Id=20715 |title=Govt was warned about attack but did nothing |last=Abbasi |first=Ansar |date=4 March 2009 |publisher=The News |accessdate=2009-03-05 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090305071956/http://www.thenews.com.pk/top_story_detail.asp?Id=20715 |archivedate=5 March 2009 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }}{{Cite news|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/lankan-group-behind-sl-cricket-team-attack-pak/100794-2.html|title= Lankan group behind SL cricket team attack|date=6 September 2009|work=CNN IBN|accessdate=6 September 2009}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.iplschedulelive.com/2016/09/vivo-ipl-2017-schedule.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170218144529/http://www.iplschedulelive.com/2016/09/vivo-ipl-2017-schedule.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=18 February 2017|title= Ipl live streaming matches|date=6 September 2009|work=Yahoo India|accessdate=6 September 2009}} | weapons = [[AK-47]]s, 6–7 [[Rocket-propelled grenade|RPG]]s and 22–70 [[hand grenades]] | numparts = 14–15{{Cite news|url=http://www.geo.tv/3-4-2009/36471.htm|title=Case registered against offenders involved in Lanka team ambush|date=4 March 2009|publisher=Geo.tv|accessdate=2009-03-04| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090309034635/http://www.geo.tv/3-4-2009/36471.htm| archivedate= 9 March 2009 | deadurl= yes}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/updates.asp?id=70497|title=Two suspects accused of Liberty ambush held|date=5 March 2009|publisher=The News(Pakistani newspaper)|accessdate=2009-03-05}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} | numpart = | dfens = [[Punjab Police (Pakistan)|Punjab Police]]/[[Elite Police]] }} {{Pakistan terrorist attacks}} The '''2009 attack on the [[Sri Lanka national cricket team]]''' occurred on 3 March 2009, when a bus carrying [[Sri Lanka]]n [[cricket]]ers, part of a larger convoy, was fired upon by 12 gunmen near [[Gaddafi Stadium]] in [[Lahore]], [[Pakistan]]. The cricketers were on their way to play the third day of the second [[Test cricket|Test]] against the [[Pakistani cricket team]]. Six members of the Sri Lanka national cricket team were wounded. Six Pakistani policemen and two civilians were killed.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/in_depth/7920260.stm|title= Gunmen shoot Sri Lanka cricketers|date=3 March 2009|work=BBC News|accessdate=3 March 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090304020128/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/in_depth/7920260.stm| archivedate= 4 March 2009 | deadurl= no|publisher=[[BBC]]}} The attack was believed to have been carried out by [[Lashkar-e-Jhangvi]]. In August 2016, three of the terrorists involved in the attack were killed during a police raid in Lahore.[http://tribune.com.pk/story/1171349/terrorists-involved-sri-lankan-cricket-team-attack-killed-lahore-raid/ Terrorists involved in Sri Lankan cricket team attack killed in Lahore raid] In October, the attack's mastermind was killed in eastern [[Afghanistan]] during a military operation, while hiding there.[http://tribune.com.pk/story/1196066/sri-lanka-cricket-team-attack-mastermind-killed-afghanistan/ ri Lanka cricket team attack mastermind 'killed' in Afghanistan] ==Background of the tour== The safety of touring cricket teams in Pakistan had long been an issue. In May 2002, [[New Zealand national cricket team|New Zealand]] abandoned their Test series in Pakistan after a [[2002 Karachi bus bombing|suicide bomb attack]] outside their hotel. However, they returned in the 2003/2004 season to fulfill their commitments.{{cite web|url=http://www.cricinfo.com/newzealand/engine/series/61139.html |title=New Zealand in Pakistan ODI Series, 2003/04 |publisher=Cricinfo |date= |accessdate=2011-12-17}} [[Australia national cricket team|Australia]] had recently refused to tour on safety grounds.{{Cite news|url=http://www.abc.net.au/pm/stories/s644978.htm|title=Australian cricket team cancel Pakistan tour|last=Knight|first=Ben |date=9 August 2002|work=ABC News|accessdate=3 March 2009}} [[Sri Lankan cricket team in Pakistan in 2008–09|The Sri Lankan cricket team was in Pakistan]] as a replacement for the [[India national cricket team|Indian team]], who had pulled out after the [[Mumbai attacks]].{{Cite news|url=http://content-uk.cricinfo.com/pakistan/content/story/383401.html|title=Sri Lanka have confirmed tour – Pakistan board|date=10 December 2008|work=Cricinfo Pakistan|accessdate=3 March 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090208034909/http://content-uk.cricinfo.com/pakistan/content/story/383401.html| archivedate=8 February 2009| deadurl= no}} In order to persuade the Sri Lankan team to visit, the Pakistan government offered to give them presidential-style security.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/03/04/world/asia/04pstan.html|title=For Pakistan, Attack Exposes Security Flaws |last=Perlez|first=Jane|work=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=2009-03-04| date=3 March 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090402020739/http://www.nytimes.com/2009/03/04/world/asia/04pstan.html| archivedate=2 April 2009| deadurl= no}} The series was the first Test tour of Pakistan since South Africa visited in October 2007.{{cite web|url=http://content-www.cricinfo.com/ci/engine/series/298999.html |title=Cricinfo – South Africa in Pakistan Test Series, 2007/08 |publisher=Content-www.cricinfo.com |date= |accessdate=2011-12-17}} ==Attack== [[File:Location of 2009 Liberty chowk attack.png|thumb|left|250px|Black/grey depicts the route for team convoy. The escape route for attackers is shown in blue.]] According to the officials, 12 gunmen were hiding near Liberty Square, in the centre of Lahore, waiting for the Sri Lankan team to pass on their way to the Gaddafi stadium. They started firing at the bus when it crossed the road. The [[Pakistan police]] escorting the team returned fire; in the ensuing fighting, six policemen and two civilians died. After about 20 minutes, the militants fled, leaving behind rocket launchers and grenades. The gunmen first shot at the wheels of the bus, and then fired at the bus itself and its occupants.{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/cricket/international/srilanka/4931223/Sri-Lankans-safe-and-out-of-danger-after-Pakistan-terror-attack.html|title=Sri Lankans 'safe and out of danger' after Pakistan terror attack|date=3 March 2009|work=[[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]]|accessdate=3 March 2009 | location=London| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090307084008/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/cricket/international/srilanka/4931223/Sri-Lankans-safe-and-out-of-danger-after-Pakistan-terror-attack.html| archivedate= 7 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} The attackers had fired a rocket at the bus, which missed and hit a nearby electric pole. The driver of the bus, Mehar Mohammad Khalil, had then kept on driving a distance of about {{Convert|500|m|ft}} until they reached the stadium. Khalil was hailed as a hero for his bravery.{{Cite news|url=http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/001200903181732.htm|title=Pakistan honours bus driver Khalil for his brave act |date=18 March 2009|work=[[The Hindu]]|accessdate=2009-03-29|location=Chennai, India| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090322124217/http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/001200903181732.htm| archivedate= 22 March 2009 | deadurl= yes}}{{cite web | url=http://www.news18.com/cricketnext/news/man-who-saved-sri-lankan-team-in-2009-lahore-attack-still-traumatised-995354.html | title=Man who saved Sri Lankan team in 2009 Lahore attack still traumatised | work=[[Network18]] | date=August 17, 2015 | accessdate=May 27, 2017 | agency=[[Agence France-Presse|AFP]]}} The attackers had also thrown a grenade under the bus, which exploded after the bus had passed over it. A minivan following the team bus carrying the match referee and umpires was also fired upon and the driver was killed. [[Simon Taufel]], [[Steve Davis (umpire)|Steve Davis]], [[Nadeem Ghauri]], [[Ahsan Raza]], umpires performance manager Peter Manuel, liaison officer Abdul Sami and ICC match referee [[Chris Broad]] were in this minivan. The minivan was subsequently allegedly abandoned by security personnel and no bullets were fired by the security forces for twenty minutes. [[Chris Broad]] threw himself over and kept his hand on the chest of [[Ahsan Raza]] to slow down the profuse bleeding from a bullet injury. A police officer who climbed into the minivan to seek cover drove the minivan to safety. Security cameras captured footage of several gunmen carrying automatic weapons and backpacks, firing on the convoy from the Liberty Square roundabout.{{Cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/asiapcf/03/02/pakistan.srilanka.attack/ |title=6 dead in attack on Sri Lankan cricketers |date=3 March 2009 |publisher=[[CNN]] |accessdate=2009-03-04 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090306212512/http://edition.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/asiapcf/03/02/pakistan.srilanka.attack/ |archivedate= 6 March 2009 |deadurl=no |df= }} They were later seen jogging up the street and escaping on motorcycles.{{Cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/asiapcf/03/04/pakistan.srilanka.attack/|title=Pakistan hunts for cricket attack gunmen|date=4 March 2009|publisher=CNN|accessdate=2009-03-04}} The video was broadcast around the world presenting pictures of the attacks. [[CCTV]] footage has been made public.{{Cite news|url=http://www.geo.tv/3-4-2009/36532.htm|title=Geo news airs exclusive footage of Lahore attackers|date=4 March 2009|publisher=[[Geo TV]] |accessdate=2009-03-05| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090308235745/http://www.geo.tv/3-4-2009/36532.htm| archivedate= 8 March 2009 | deadurl= yes}} They arrived at 8:39 am local time and left at 8:46 am. The attackers were armed with [[AK-47]] assault rifles, [[hand grenades]], [[Rocket-propelled grenade|RPG]] launchers, [[M18A1 Claymore Antipersonnel Mine|claymore]]s and [[explosive charge]]s.{{Cite news|url=http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/Dawn%20Content%20Library/dawn/news/pakistan/punjab/Mumbai-terror-visits-Lahore-hs |title=Mumbai terror visits Lahore |last=Faisal Ali |first=Muhammad |author2=Husnain Ghayoor |date=5 March 2009 |publisher=[[Dawn (newspaper)|Dawn]] |accessdate=2009-03-05 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{Cite news|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/top_story_detail.asp?Id=20746|archive-url=https://archive.is/20120912204716/http://www.thenews.com.pk/top_story_detail.asp?Id=20746|dead-url=yes|archive-date=12 September 2012|title=Several Lahore attack suspects arrested|last=Perwaiz|first=Salis bin|date=5 March 2009|publisher=[[The News International]] |accessdate=2009-03-05}} The Sri Lankan team were then taken to the stadium and airlifted from the pitch via [[Pakistan Air Force]] [[Mil Mi-17|Mil Mi-17 helicopter]]s,{{Cite news|url=http://www.geosuper.tv/news_detail.asp?id=14410|title=Sri Lankan team being evacuated by helicopter|publisher=[[Geo Super]]|accessdate=2009-03-03}} and immediate arrangements were made for the Sri Lankan team to return to [[Colombo]] on the next available flight.{{Cite news|url=http://cricketnext.in.com/news/tour-cancelled-after-lanka-team-is-fired-at/38740-13.html|title=Lankan players escape with minor injuries in attack|accessdate=2009-03-03| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090306113004/http://cricketnext.in.com/news/tour-cancelled-after-lanka-team-is-fired-at/38740-13.html| archivedate= 6 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} The second Test, which was the last scheduled fixture of the tour, was abandoned as a draw.{{cite web |subscription=yes |url=https://cricketarchive.com/Archive/Scorecards/211/211023/211023_bbb.html|title=Pakistan v Sri Lanka in 2008/09|date=3 March 2009|publisher=CricketArchive|accessdate=3 March 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090304182846/http://www.cricketarchive.com/Archive/Scorecards/211/211023/211023_bbb.html| archivedate= 4 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} ==Injuries== Several team members sustained minor wounds, including:[[File:Mahela Jayawardene.jpg|150px|right|thumb|Sri Lankan captain [[Mahela Jayawardene]] was one of those injured.]] * [[Thilan Samaraweera]] * [[Kumar Sangakkara]] (vice-captain) * [[Tharanga Paranavitana]] * [[Ajantha Mendis]] * [[Chaminda Vaas]] * [[Mahela Jayawardene]] (captain) * [[Suranga Lakmal]] Six Pakistani policemen and two civilians were killed in the attack.{{Cite news|url=http://www.skynews.com.au/news/article.aspx?id=308388 |title=Sri Lankan cricket team in shooting |date=3 March 2009 |work=Sky News |accessdate=3 March 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090304061017/http://skynews.com.au/news/article.aspx?id=308388 |archivedate=4 March 2009 |deadurl=yes }} Samaraweera and Paranavitana were hospitalised following the incident. The others had sustained minor injuries and shrapnel wounds.{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/cricket/international/srilanka/4930665/Sri-Lanka-cricket-players-lucky-to-survive-terror-attack-in-Pakistan.html|title=Sri Lanka cricket players lucky to survive terror attack in Pakistan|last=Briggs|first=Simon |date=3 March 2009|work=The Telegraph|accessdate=3 March 2009 | location=London| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090307005622/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/cricket/international/srilanka/4930665/Sri-Lanka-cricket-players-lucky-to-survive-terror-attack-in-Pakistan.html| archivedate= 7 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} Samaraweera sustained shrapnel wounds to his thigh, and Paranavitana to his chest.{{Cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/cricket/international/srilanka/4931483/Sri-Lanka-cricket-attacks-Kumar-Sangakkara-injured-in-Pakistan-shooting.html|title=Sri Lanka cricket attacks: Kumar Sangakkara injured in Pakistan shooting |last=Briggs |first=Simon |date=3 March 2009|work=The Telegraph|accessdate=3 March 2009 | location=London| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090307002437/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/cricket/international/srilanka/4931483/Sri-Lanka-cricket-attacks-Kumar-Sangakkara-injured-in-Pakistan-shooting.html| archivedate= 7 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} The team's Assistant Coach [[Paul Farbrace]] was also injured.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/cricket/7920306.stm|title= Lahore Test scrapped after attack |accessdate=2009-03-03 | work=BBC News |publisher=[[BBC]]| date=3 March 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090304172510/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/cricket/7920306.stm| archivedate= 4 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} Although it was reported that Coach [[Trevor Bayliss]] also sustained minor injuries,{{cite news|url=https://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20090303/ap_on_re_as/as_pakistan |title=Sri Lankan cricket team attacked in Pakistan |agency=Associated Press |accessdate=2009-03-03 |last=Ali |first=Rizwan |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090304184425/http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20090303/ap_on_re_as/as_pakistan |archivedate=4 March 2009 |deadurl=yes }}{{cite web|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/ukpress/article/ALeqM5ibVbw8W41ERhnnfl-NybHJj2w4GA|title=Five Sri Lanka players injured – Sports Minister|publisher= [[The Press Association]] |accessdate=2009-03-03|last=|first=| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090306211025/https://www.google.com/hostednews/ukpress/article/ALeqM5ibVbw8W41ERhnnfl-NybHJj2w4GA| archivedate= 6 March 2009 | deadurl= yes}} it was later announced that this was incorrect. Reserve umpire [[Ahsan Raza]], who was travelling in a van for the umpires that was following the Sri Lankan team bus, was shot twice and taken to hospital.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-32829651 |title=In pictures: Pakistan readies for return of international cricket |accessdate=22 May 2015 |work=BBC Sport}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.sindhtoday.net/sports/70109.htm |title=Pakistani umpire critically injured in Lahore attack |accessdate=2009-03-03 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090306212941/http://www.sindhtoday.net/sports/70109.htm |archivedate=6 March 2009 |deadurl=yes }} The driver of the minibus was killed in the attack.{{Cite news|title=Chris Broad hailed as hero after Lahore attack | url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/mar/03/lahore-sri-lanka-cricket | date=3 March 2009 | author=Bowcott, Owen | accessdate=2009-03-03 | work=Guardian | location=London| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090304184958/http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2009/mar/03/lahore-sri-lanka-cricket| archivedate= 4 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} ==Investigation and attribution== Immediately following the attacks, unnamed Pakistani authorities blamed the [[Lashkar-e-Taiba]] (LeT), a militant organisation banned in both Pakistan and India.{{Cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5838998.ece|title=All 14 gunmen escape after deadly attack on Sri Lankan cricketers in Lahore|date=3 March 2009|work=[[Times Online]]|publisher= Times Online |accessdate=3 March 2009 | location=London | first1=Jeremy | last1=Page | first2=Jenny | last2=Booth}}[https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/asia/strike-had-hallmarks-of-mumbai-massacre-1636831.html Strike had hallmarks of Mumbai massacre], [[The Independent]], 2009-03-03 Pakistani officials said that the attacks were similar to the Mumbai attacks. Most of the Pakistani press blamed Pakistani Islamist militants and [[Al-Qaeda]] for the attacks.[http://www.canberratimes.com.au/news/world/world/general/two-dozen-held-in-lahore-as-fbi-director-arrives/1450770.aspx Two dozen held in Lahore as FBI director arrives]{{dead link|date=September 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, [[The Canberra Times]], 2009-03-o5 Police said that kidnapping was a possible motive, but police officials refused to comment on this. [[Sri Lankan Foreign Minister]] [[Rohitha Bogollagama]] said on 4 March that he could not rule out involvement of the rebel [[Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam]] (LTTE) in the Lahore attacks.{{Cite news|url=http://www.thenews.com.pk/top_story_detail.asp?Id=20740|title=Lahore attacks| publisher=[[The News International]] |date=5 March 2009|accessdate=2009-03-05}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} Some European intelligence sources supported this suspicion.{{Cite news|url=http://www.asiantribune.com/?q=node/15896 |title=TTE-Mujahideen link suspected in attack on cricketers |date=5 March 2009 |accessdate=2009-03-05 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090310071430/http://www.asiantribune.com/?q=node%2F15896 |archivedate=10 March 2009 |deadurl=no |df= }} Sri Lankan military officials, on the other hand, were skeptical of LTTE involvement,{{cite news| url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/29475541/print/1/displaymode/1098/| title=Gunmen attack Sri Lankan cricket team in Pakistan|last=Ali|first=Rizwan|date=3 March 2009|agency=[[Associated Press]]|publisher=[[MSNBC]]|accessdate=3 March 2009}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} and an LTTE spokesperson labelled reports of LTTE connection as 'not true'.[http://www.ptinews.com/pti%5Cptisite.nsf/0/4D51E3CCE683A84F65257570001B7F0E?OpenDocument Press Trust of India (2009), ''LTTE denies link to Lahore attack''.]{{dead link|date=December 2011}} A junior Pakistani cabinet minister said that the government had evidence that the attackers came from India, but [[Ministry of Information, Broadcasting and National Heritage (Pakistan)|Information Minister]] [[Sherry Rehman]] denied any government knowledge of Indian involvement.{{Cite news|url=http://in.reuters.com/article/southAsiaNews/idINIndia-38317420090303?sp=true|title=Sense of crisis deepens in Pakistan after Lahore attack|first=Zeeshan|last=Haider|date=3 March 2009|work=Reuters|publisher=Reuters India|accessdate=3 March 2009}} On 6 March 2009, government officials had ruled out the involvement of Indian intelligence agency [[Research and Analysis Wing]] and LTTE and were zeroing in on Lashkar-e-Taiba.[http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/Dawn%20Content%20Library/dawn/news/pakistan/investigators+see+let+footprints+in+lahore+attack--sal-up Investigators see LeT footprints in Lahore attack]{{dead link|date=September 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, [[Dawn (newspaper)]], 2009-03-06[http://www.hindu.com/2009/03/06/stories/2009030658730100.htm Pakistan rules out Indian hand], [[The Hindu]], 2009-03-06 Sri Lankan Foreign Minister [[Rohitha Bogollagama]] was quoted as saying
From our point of view, there is no Indian involvement. India has helped us in our counter-terrorist efforts. I don't see a need for India to target the Sri Lankan cricket team.
On the morning of the attack, the Sri Lankan and Pakistani cricket teams did not depart from the hotel together, as they had done on previous days, and the Pakistani team's schedule was delayed by 5 minutes. Statements by Australian umpire Simon Taufel, match referee Chris Broad, and spin bowler [[Muttiah Muralitharan]], referencing this delay sparked [[conspiracy theories]] that the militants were acting on inside information.{{Cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5850290.ece|title=Five-minute gap fuels conspiracy theory over Lahore terror attack|author2=Jeremy Page in Lahore and Anne Barrowclough in Sydney |date=5 March 2009|publisher=The Times|accessdate=2009-03-07 | location=London|first=Fariha|last=Karim}} Later, Muralitharan expressed alarm at such interpretations of his comments and explained that he only suspected the gunmen to be monitoring the team movements.{{Cite news|url=http://thelede.blogs.nytimes.com/2009/03/06/theories-and-conspiracy-theories-on-lahore/?hp|title=Rumors and Theories About the Lahore Attack|last=Mackey|first=Robert|date=7 March 2009|work=The New York Times|accessdate=2009-03-07| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090310172928/http://thelede.blogs.nytimes.com/2009/03/06/theories-and-conspiracy-theories-on-lahore/?hp| archivedate= 10 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]] director [[Robert Mueller]] arrived in Pakistan the day after these attacks and met with Pakistani officials to discuss security issues and the Mumbai attacks.[http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2009/03/04/asia/AS-Pakistan-FBI-Director.php FBI chief in Pakistan after attack on cricketers], [[International Herald Tribune]], 2009-03-04 Interior Adviser Rehman Malik, told the [[National Assembly (Pakistan)#Standing Committees|National Assembly Standing Committee on the Interior]] that no evidence of LeT's involvement has been found so far, and that sufficient evidence has been surfaced pointing to involvement of a foreign hand. ===Security lapse=== The Investigation committee found three [[Superintendent (police)#Pakistan|Superintendents of police]] (SPs) to have neglected the initial warning.{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/mar/03/sri-lanka-cricket-team-attack-warning|title=Warning of attacks on Sri Lanka cricket team was ignored |date=3 March 2009|work=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=2009-04-06 | location=London | first=Saeed | last=Shah| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090306104828/http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2009/mar/03/sri-lanka-cricket-team-attack-warning| archivedate= 6 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} by [[Intelligence agencies]]{{Cite news|url=http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn-content-library/dawn/news/pakistan/punjab/three-sps-found-negligent-in-liberty-attack--zj |title=Three SPs found negligent in Liberty attack |date=2 April 2009 |publisher=Dawn.com |accessdate=2009-04-03 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} The [[Chief Minister of Punjab (Pakistan)|Chief Minister of Punjab]] had also tipped off the authorities about a possible threat to the Sri Lankan team a month before.{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/7925501.stm|title=Lahore suspect sketches released |date=5 March 2009|publisher=[[BBC]]|accessdate=2009-04-03| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090310012759/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/7925501.stm| archivedate= 10 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} ===Arrests=== On 5 March, [[Salmaan Taseer]], the [[Governor of Punjab (Pakistan)|governor]] of [[Punjab (Pakistan)|Punjab]] province, said the individuals responsible for the attack had been identified, but would not be revealed until the investigation was complete.{{Cite news|url=http://www.ptinews.com/apti%5Cptisite.nsf/0/E6DEDC1C0235C1E165257570004C81B7?OpenDocument|title=Pak investigators identify terrorists behind SL cricket team attack|last=|first=|date=5 March 2009|work=[[Press Trust of India]]|publisher=|accessdate=5 March 2009}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} The province offered a reward of 10 million [[Pakistani rupee|rupees]] ($125,000 USD) for information leading to the capture of the militants responsible for the attack.{{cite web|url=http://pakistancrickethighlights.info/behind-pakistans-inconsistency-in-limited-over-cricket|title=Attack on Sri Lankan team in Lahore}} Police in Punjab arrested over 250 suspects, including 4 who were said to be 'prime suspects'. Police called Muhammad Aqeel, who ran a sports bikes business in [[Islampura]], the mastermind behind the attack, and said that he had received a call from one of the militants at 9:05 am on the morning of the attacks asking for instructions. Though Aqeel was still absconding, his brother, Muhammad Faisal, had been arrested.{{Cite news|url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2009\03\05\story_5-3-2009_pg1_1| title = Police widen hunt for 3/3 clues| date = 5 March 2009|accessdate=2009-03-05| work = [[Daily Times (Pakistan)|Daily Times]]}} Police also arrested Shahzad Babar of [[Rahim Yar Khan]] after a [[Subscriber Identity Module]] (SIM) card registered in his name was used in the attack along with eight others.{{Cite news|url=http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/Dawn%20Content%20Library/dawn/news/pakistan/suspects+arrested+in+sri+lanka+team+attack-rs|title=Suspects arrested in Sri Lanka team attack |work = [[Dawn (newspaper)|Dawn]]| date=4 March 2009|accessdate=2009-03-05}} Security officials in [[Pakistan]] told [[The Times]] that most of the two dozen people arrested in connection with the attacks belonged to [[Jaish-e-Mohammed]], [[Lashkar-e-Jhangvi]], outlawed militant groups with close links to [[Al-Qaeda]].[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5854505.ece Gunmen who attacked cricketers in Lahore 'had links to al-Qaeda'], [[The Times]], 2009-03-06 Aqeel, who is an activist of Lashkar-e-Jhangvi, escaped a police raid on his home in [[Kahuta]] on 9 March 2009.[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5875297.ece Lahore attack 'mastermind' escapes police raid in Punjab], [[The Times]], 2009-03-09 Also another gunman Zubair, aka Naik Mohammad, of Zubair, was arrested from Madina Colony, Walton Road in Lahore. He was a waiter at a hotel in Rawalpindi, when he was recruited by Sifullah. He went to [[Miram Shah]] and was trained in the use of different weapons. Other accused including Samiullah, alias Ejaz of [[Nankana Sahib District|Nankana district]], Adnan, alias Sajjad, Ajmal alias Ahsaan, Farooq, Ameer of Punjab [[Taliban]], and Umer, alias Abdul Wahab of [[D. I. Khan]], were still at large. The attack was planned at Tauheed Hotel, and a house rented for this purpose in Madina Colony, Walton Road. The [[auto rickshaws]] used in the attack were purchased by Samiullah. A secret investigative report has surfaced later prepared by the Additional Inspector General of the Crime Investigation Division, Punjab on 22 January 2009 outlining the potential threat to the Sri Lankan team.{{Cite news|url=http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn-content-library/dawn/news/pakistan/11-police-track-mastermind-of-attack-on-lankan-cricket-team--il--04|title=Sri Lankan team attack suspect held|last=Dawn Staff Reporter |date=17 June 2009|publisher=[[Dawn (newspaper)|Dawn]]|accessdate=2009-06-27| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090620151639/http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn-content-library/dawn/news/pakistan/11-police-track-mastermind-of-attack-on-lankan-cricket-team--il--04| archivedate= 20 June 2009 | deadurl= no}} ==Reactions== ===Pakistan and Sri Lanka=== {{PAK}} – The attack has been condemned by the Pakistani president, [[Asif Ali Zardari]], and prime minister, [[Yousaf Raza Gillani]].{{Cite news|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-03/03/content_10934149.htm|title= Pakistani leaders condemn attack on Sri Lankan cricket team |date=3 March 2009|work=Xinhua News Agency|accessdate=3 March 2009}} Governor [[Salmaan Taseer]] stated that the same people who executed the 2008 Mumbai attacks were responsible for this attack.[http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2009%5C03%5C04%5Cstory_4-3-2009_pg3_1 Al Qaeda strikes in Lahore...] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090307203236/http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2009%5C03%5C04%5Cstory_4-3-2009_pg3_1 |date=7 March 2009 }}, [[Daily Times (Pakistan)]], 2009-03-03[http://www.geo.tv/3-3-2009/36380.htm These are the same terrorists, who attacked Mumbai: Salman Taseer] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090306102838/http://www.geo.tv/3-3-2009/36380.htm |date=6 March 2009 }}, [[Geo TV]], 2009-03-03 Following the attack Pakistan's interior minister [[Rehman Malik]] declared that Pakistan is "in a state of war".[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5841981.ece Terrorists turn guns on cricket in Pakistan, a nation at war with itself], [[The Times]], 2009-03-03 Pakistani officials were also quick to blame one of its neighbours, India, of covert involvement, citing long standing enmity between the two [[South Asian]] countries.{{cite web|url=http://archives.dawn.com/archives/95218 |title=Chidambaram denies Indian link to Lahore attack |work=dawn.com |publisher=Pakistan Herald Publication (Pvt) Limited |date=5 March 2009 |accessdate=12 April 2016}} These claims were largely seen as an exercise in diverting attention away from the crisis.{{cite web|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/News-Feed/pakistan/Pakistan-identifies-Sri-Lankan-cricket-attackers/Article1-386793.aspx |title=Pakistan identifies Sri Lankan cricket attackers |publisher=Hindustan Times |date=5 March 2009 |accessdate=2011-12-17 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121021034859/http://www.hindustantimes.com/News-Feed/pakistan/Pakistan-identifies-Sri-Lankan-cricket-attackers/Article1-386793.aspx |archivedate=21 October 2012 |df= }} [[Chief Minister of Punjab (Pakistan)]] [[Shahbaz Sharif]], criticised the current government and said that he has already tipped authorities of a possible attack. ''[[DAWN (newspaper)]]'' condemned the attack and cited security loopholes.{{cite news|url=http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/Dawn%20Content%20Library/dawn/news/pakistan/lahore-attacks-in-the-urdu-press-ha |title=Lahore attacks in the Urdu press |date=4 March 2009 |publisher=Dawn(Pakistani newspaper) |accessdate=2009-03-05 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} The [[Daily Times (Pakistan)|''Daily Times'']], blamed Al Qaeda and Lashkar-e Jhangvi in an editorial, stating, "International cricket is no longer possible in Pakistan; therefore we should stop accusing foreign teams of discriminating against Pakistan vis-à-vis India. The question here is of the survival of Pakistan, not of cricket."{{cite web|url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2009\story_4-3-2009_pg3_1 |title=EDITORIAL: Al Qaeda strikes in Lahore |publisher=Dailytimes.com.pk |date= |accessdate=2011-12-17 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090307203236/http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2009%5C03%5C04%5Cstory_4-3-2009_pg3_1 |archivedate= 7 March 2009 |df= }} The ''[[Daily Jang]]'', responding on Chris Broad, Simon Taufel and Steve Davis's comments, said that their "vivid description of the terrifying attack gives us an insight into how people everywhere will see the events of the morning of March 3." It went on to say the "men appeared genuinely shocked over the sight of Pakistani security men running for cover". The paper goes on to say that "their candid comments will seal the fate of Pakistan cricket for some time to come". It also said that Pakistan "must give up complaining" and that "ways to liven up the game at the domestic level need to be reconsidered with renewed urgency".[http://thenews.jang.com.pk/daily_detail.asp?id=165953 First-hand nightmares – The News] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090827054147/http://thenews.jang.com.pk/daily_detail.asp?id=165953 |date=27 August 2009 }}. {{LKA}} – President, [[Mahinda Rajapaksa]], said, "I condemn this cowardly terrorist attack targeting the Sri Lankan cricket team. The Sri Lankan players had gone to Pakistan as ambassadors of goodwill."{{cite news|url=http://www.khaleejtimes.com/DisplayArticle08.asp?xfile=data/international/2009/March/international_March182.xml§ion=international |title=Lankan president condemns attack |date=3 March 2009 |work=AFP |publisher=Khaleej Times |accessdate=3 March 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110608195443/http://www.khaleejtimes.com/DisplayArticle08.asp?xfile=data%2Finternational%2F2009%2FMarch%2Finternational_March182.xml§ion=international |archivedate=8 June 2011 |df= }} Prime Minister [[Ratnasiri Wickremanayake]] said that "Sri Lanka and Pakistan share a [[Pakistan-Sri Lanka relations|very close relationship]] and we will take all steps to protect this relationship."[http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/000200903041941.htm Ties with Pakistan will continue: Sri Lankan PM] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121103230016/http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/000200903041941.htm |date=3 November 2012 }}. The driver of the bus whose presence of mind saved the cricketers was hailed as a hero.[http://sundaytimes.lk/090308/News/sundaytimesnews_13.html Mehar Mohammad Khalil: A hero across borders], [[The Sunday Times (Sri Lanka)|The Sunday Times]], 2009-03-08 The Sri Lankan team praised the bus driver. Then-captain of [[Sri Lanka]] [[Mahela Jayawardene]] praised Khalil saying he owed his life to the driver. Spinner [[Muttiah Muralitharan]] gave Khalil his team shirt.[http://www.theage.com.au/articles/2009/03/05/1235842498871.html Lankans home, thank bus driver ], ''[[The Age]]'', 2009-03-05. ===Supranational=== ===Others=== {{Flag|United Nations}} – Secretary General [[Ban Ki Moon]] strongly condemned the attacks according to UN spokesman Marie Okabe. She also added that "Any attack targeting civilians, in this case athletes, is despicable and unjustifiable, and we urge authorities in Pakistan to do all in their power to find the culprits and bring them to justice."{{cite web |url=http://india.gov.in/outerwin.php?id=http://www.ddinews.gov.in/International/International+-+Other+Stories/un+attack.htm |title=National Portal of India |publisher=India.gov.in |date= |accessdate=2010-09-20}} The [[International Cricket Council]] – Chief Executive [[Haroon Lorgat]] said:
We note with dismay and regret the events of this morning in Lahore and we condemn this attack without reservation. It is a source of great sadness that there have been a number of fatalities in this attack and it is also very upsetting for the wider cricket family that some of the Sri Lanka players and one match official have been injured in this attack. At this time our thoughts and prayers are with the injured people and also the families of those who have died.{{cite press release|url=http://icc-cricket.yahoo.com/media-release/2009/march/media-release20090303-5.html |title=ICC statement following terror attack in Lahore |date=3 March 2009 |publisher=International Cricket Council |accessdate=3 March 2009 }}{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}
The [[West Indies Cricket Board]] made a statement through president [[Julian Hunte]] and said "It was a sad day for International Cricket", and gave their full sympathy to the Sri Lankan players and the umpires.[https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5ixlQrMPilkjn3RssZ53ZHlbL-XuA xxx]. Indian and New Zealand players wore black armbands while playing their next One Day International as a show of solidarity towards the Sri Lankan players injured in the attack,[http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/007200903031813.htm Lahore attack: India, NZ players sport black armbands] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120126153631/http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/007200903031813.htm |date=26 January 2012 }}, [[The Hindu]], 2009-03-03. as did Australia and South Africa while playing their next test.{{original research inline|date=November 2014}} ===Other countries=== {{AUS}} – Prime Minister [[Kevin Rudd]] also condemned the attack on the Sri Lankan cricket team, calling it "shameful and cowardly".{{cite news |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2009/03/04/2507291.htm?section=sport |title=Rudd denounces 'doubly atrocious' Lahore attack |publisher=[[ABC News (Australia)]] |date=4 March 2009 |accessdate=2009-03-04| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090308235928/http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2009/03/04/2507291.htm?section=sport| archivedate= 8 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} He demanded answers from Pakistan after claims that police left Australians travelling with Sri Lanka's cricket team in the lurch as the bus was attacked. "I am sufficiently concerned about what has been said by the Australians that we need an explanation and we intend to get one."[http://www.canberratimes.com.au/news/local/news/general/lahore-link-to-alqaeda-as-suspects-identified/1452965.aspx Lahore link to al-Qaeda as suspects identified] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090308053347/http://www.canberratimes.com.au/news/local/news/general/lahore-link-to-alqaeda-as-suspects-identified/1452965.aspx |date=8 March 2009 }}, ''[[The Canberra Times]]'', 2009-03-7. Foreign Minister [[Stephen Smith (Australian politician)|Stephen Smith]] said the attack demonstrates that there is a persistent threat to Pakistan's very existence and showed the need for a tougher war against extremists.{{cite web |url=http://www.alertnet.org/thenews/newsdesk/SYD392271.htm |title=Attacks threat to Pakistan's existence: Australia |publisher= Reuters |accessdate=2009-03-04 |last= |first=| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090305140416/http://alertnet.org/thenews/newsdesk/SYD392271.htm| archivedate= 5 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} {{CHN}} – Foreign Ministry spokesman Qin Gang said that the Chinese government expressed deep condolences to the victims and sincere sympathy to the wounded.[http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-03/04/content_10943071.htm China condemns attack on Sri Lanka's cricket team in Pakistan], [[Xinhua News Agency]], 2009-03-04. {{FRA}} – French Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs expressed solidarity with the Pakistani people and authorities at this "testing time".http://www.ambafrance-in.org/03-03-2009-France-condemns-attack {{IND}} – [[Home Minister]] [[P. Chidambaram]] expressed shock over the attack on the Sri Lankan cricket team in Pakistan: "We condemn the incident. We are sorry for the Sri Lankan team. We hope that the players ... I read two, three names ... Samaraweera, Mendis ... I hope they are safe and will recover. We are shocked by that incident."{{cite news|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/India/Security-of-Sri-Lankan-players-hopelessly-inadequate-Chidambaram/articleshow/4216798.cms |title=Security of Sri Lankan players hopelessly inadequate: Chidambaram |date=3 March 2009 |work=[[Times of India]] |accessdate=3 March 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20090306175548/http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/India/Security-of-Sri-Lankan-players-hopelessly-inadequate-Chidambaram/articleshow/4216798.cms |archivedate=6 March 2009 }} Further he said that Pakistan could become a failed state and it was not clear who was in control of the country.[http://in.reuters.com/article/southAsiaNews/idINIndia-38383620090306 Pakistan threatening to become failed state – India], [[Reuters]], 2009-03-6.[http://www.csmonitor.com/2009/0305/p04s01-wosc.html Attack on Sri Lanka cricket team: a sign that Pakistan is unraveling?], ''[[Christian Science Monitor]]'', 2009-03-05. {{NZ}} - Prime Minister [[John Key]] was outraged over the attack. He called it a "despicable terrorist act" while condemning the attack. He further said that he intends to convey "a message of condolence to the Sri Lankan Government and Sri Lankan cricket team".{{cite news|title=Sporting world in shock as terror finds new target|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/sport/news/article.cfm?c_id=4&objectid=10559823|accessdate=15 February 2017|work=[[The New Zealand Herald]]|date=March 4, 2009}} {{TUR}} – [[Foreign Minister]] [[Ali Babacan]] called Pakistan's [[Foreign Minister]] [[Makhdoom Shah Mehmood Qureshi]] and offered his condolences personally and on behalf of the government and the people of Turkey.{{cite news|url=http://www.onlinenews.com.pk/details.php?id=141790 |title=Australian, Turkish FM call Qureshi, regret tragic incident in Lahore |date=4 March 2009 |publisher=Online International News Network (Pakistani website) |accessdate=2009-03-04 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110928011225/http://www.onlinenews.com.pk/details.php?id=141790 |archivedate=28 September 2011 |df= }} {{UK}} – Prime Minister [[Gordon Brown]], commenting on the attacks, said that Pakistan must clamp down on such perpetrators in its midst and said that a vast majority of Al-Qaeda fighters were in Pakistan, adding the government must make arrests to show it is "fulfilling its role in the world community".{{cite news |url=http://www.geo.tv/3-4-2009/36504.htm |title=Brown urges Pakistan action after cricket attack |date=4 March 2009 |publisher=[[Geo TV]] |accessdate=2009-03-05| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090309232254/http://www.geo.tv/3-4-2009/36504.htm| archivedate= 9 March 2009 | deadurl= yes}} Foreign Secretary [[David Miliband]] stated that Pakistan was facing a "mortal threat" from internal militancy.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/7927859.stm Pakistan facing 'mortal threat'], [[BBC]], 2009-03-06. {{USA}} – President [[Barack Obama]] expressed deep concern over the attack.{{cite news |title=Obama expresses deep concern after Pakistan cricket attack |publisher= [[Agence France-Presse]] |date=2009-03-03 |last= |first=}} [[United States Secretary of State|Secretary of State]] [[Hillary Clinton]] called these attacks an "eerie replica" of the Mumbai attacks and said Pakistan was facing a serious internal security threat.[http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2009\03\06\story_6-3-2009_pg1_1 Pakistan facing serious internal threat: Hillary], [[Daily Times (Pakistan)]], 2009-03-06.[[United States Ambassador to Afghanistan|Ambassador to Afghanistan]] [[Christopher Dell]] mused that Pakistan potentially posed a bigger security problem for the rest of the world than Afghanistan.{{cite web | url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/pakistan/4941262/Sri-Lanka-cricketers-attack-Pakistan-greater-threat-than-Afghanistan.html | title=Sri Lanka cricketers attack: Pakistan 'greater threat than Afghanistan' | work=Daily Telegraph | date=March 5, 2009 | accessdate=December 16, 2017 | author=Farmer, Ben | location=Kabul | quote="From where I sit [Pakistan] sure looks like it's going to be a bigger problem," Mr Dell told the Guardian newspaper. "Pakistan is a bigger place, has a larger population, its nuclear-armed. It has certainly made radical Islam a part of its political life, and it now seems to be a deeply ingrained element of its political culture. It makes things there very hard."}} ==Criticism== Politician and ex-Pakistan cricket captain [[Imran Khan]] criticised the security arrangements and said that the security provided was 10 times less than what is provided to government officials{{cite web|url=http://www.thestandard.com.hk/news_detail.asp?pp_cat=17&art_id=79076&sid=22963925&con_type=1 |title=The Standard article on Imran Khan |publisher=Thestandard.com.hk |date= |accessdate=2011-12-17 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110629121351/http://www.thestandard.com.hk/news_detail.asp?pp_cat=17&art_id=79076&sid=22963925&con_type=1 |archivedate=29 June 2011 |df= }} such as [[Rehman Malik]].[http://www.telegraphindia.com/1090304/jsp/sports/story_10622545.jsp Telegraph India investigation on security flaws].[https://www.theguardian.com/sport/blog/2009/mar/04/sri-lanka-cricket-team-attack-subcontinent-reaction "For us in Asia, the boundary rope has been moved"]. ''[[The Guardian]]'', 4 March 2009. [[Match referee]] [[Chris Broad]] was also critical of the security provided. He stated that he and his colleagues were left like 'sitting ducks' in the trailing minivan during the attack.[http://uk.reuters.com/article/sportsNews/idUKTRE5232PY20090304 "Broad slams security over Lahore attack"]. [[Reuters]], 2009-03-04. He also accused the security personnel of fleeing the scene.[https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/mar/05/lahore-terror-attacks-chris-broad "Police left us like sitting ducks, says referee"], ''[[The Guardian]]'', 2009-03-05. He questioned why the Pakistan team which usually travelled with the Sri Lankan team was delayed by seven minutes that day and avoided being attacked.[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5854504.ece "Seven-minute delay that kept Pakistan's cricket squad from harm"], ''[[The Times]]'', 2009-03-06. [[Javed Miandad]] was critical of Broad's comments and demanded that International Cricket Council ban him for life.[https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2009/mar/06/miandad-broad-ban-lahore "Miandad demands life ban for outspoken Broad"], ''[[The Guardian]]'', 2009-03-06. [[Pakistan Cricket Board]] lodged a formal complaint against Chris Broad with the International Cricket Council on 9 March 2009.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/cricket/7934423.stm "Pakistan register Broad complaint"], ''[[BBC News]]'', 2009-03-10. Ijaz Butt, the head of Pakistan Cricket Board accused Broad of lying.[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/pakistan/4944703/Sri-Lankan-cricketers-Pakistan-accuses-Chris-Broad-of-lying-about-terror-attack.html "Pakistan accuses Chris Broad of lying about terror attack"], ''[[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]]'', 2009-03-06. Umpire [[Simon Taufel]] also said that the umpire's minibus was abandoned while the players' bus was moved to the ground to evacuate the players.{{cite news |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2009/03/05/2508022.htm |title=Aussie umpires slam Pakistan security arrangements |date=5 March 2009 |work=ABC News |accessdate=2009-03-05| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090306213458/http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2009/03/05/2508022.htm| archivedate= 6 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} Criticising the security entourage for abandoning them and inability of the police to arrest the attackers Simon said, "You tell me why no one was caught. You tell me why. Supposedly 25 armed commandos were in our convoy, and when the team bus got going again, we were left on our own." Co-umpire [[Steve Davis (umpire)|Steve Davis]] said "he felt let down" by the security. International Cricket Council umpires performance manager for East Asia, Sri Lanka and Pakistan, Peter Manuel told ''[[Dawn (newspaper)|Dawn]]'' that the minivan carrying the umpires was basically abandoned by the security personnel: "It was unbelievable. Bullets were raining on us and not a shot was fired in our defense by the Pakistan security officials."[http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn+content+library/dawn/news/pakistan/we-were-basically-abandoned-szh We were basically abandoned']{{dead link|date=September 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, [[Dawn (newspaper)|''Dawn'']], 2009-03-8. Sri Lanka coach [[Trevor Bayliss]] backed the comments made by [[Simon Taufel]], Chris Broad and Steve Davis criticising the security.[http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,12123_5031669,00.html "Bayliss backs officials"], ''[[Sky Sports]]'', 2009-03-10. Intikhab Alab, Pakistan cricket team's coach, asked Chris Broad to apologise to his country and team due to the remarks he made against Pakistani police security.[http://dailymailnews.com/200903/13/news/dmsportspage01.html "Intikhab asks Broad to apologize for remarks"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090808065751/http://dailymailnews.com/200903/13/news/dmsportspage01.html |date=8 August 2009 }}, ''The Daily Mail'' (Pakistan). English cricketer [[Dominic Cork]] who was commentating in Pakistan on the series and who himself was caught in the attack later criticised the security and Pakistan Cricket Board chairman [[Ijaz Butt]].{{cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,12123_5009385,00.html|title=Cork slams PCB chief|date=5 March 2009|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=12 March 2011}} Sri Lankan bowler [[Muttiah Muralitharan]] said the security arrangement was the worst he had ever seen, and vastly inferior to that provided in [[Sri Lanka]]. He said "The security people we had didn't even seem to fight back. Were they professionals with enough training? They didn't seem to know what to do. I was surprised the terrorists were able to just reload the magazines and keep firing, and they never got caught. It was shameful. If this had happened in [[Colombo]] they would never have got away."[http://www.theage.com.au/articles/2009/03/06/1235842584734.html "Lahore security was shameful, says Murali"], ''[[The Age]]'', 2009-03-06. Eye witness Habib Akram, bureau chief of [[SAMAA TV]] news channel, said that the gunmen were very calm as they moved and fired by turns and that there was hardly any fire returned by the police. His office overlooks the traffic circle where the incident took place.{{cite news |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=20601081&sid=akGSVrqD10aI&refer=australia |title=Pakistan Shows Tape of Gunmen Escaping After Attack (Update2) |date=5 March 2009 |work=ABC News |first=Khalid Qayum |last=Ed Johnson |accessdate=2009-03-05}} [[Closed-circuit television]] footage of the event reported by [[Geo TV]] showed four of the attackers walking or jogging away unchallenged from the site, into a marketplace while no policemen are seen. Former president and former army chief [[Pervez Musharraf]] criticised the police commandos inability to kill any of the gunmen, saying "If this was the [[Elite Police|elite force]] I would expect them to have shot down those people who attacked them, the reaction, their training should be on a level that if anyone shoots toward the company they are guarding, in less than three seconds they should shoot the man down."[http://www.voanews.com/english/2009-03-05-voa13.cfm "Pakistan Cricket Ambush Controversy Focuses on Security"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090307112722/http://www.voanews.com/english/2009-03-05-voa13.cfm |date=7 March 2009 }}, ''[[Voice of America]]'', 2009-03-05.{{cite news |url=http://www.gulfnews.com/world/Pakistan/10292058.html |title=Elite force should have killed terrorists |last=Rehman Khan |first=Fasihur |date=5 March 2009 |publisher=Gulfnews |accessdate=2009-03-07 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090307100348/http://www.gulfnews.com/world/Pakistan/10292058.html |archivedate=7 March 2009 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} Governor of Punjab province where the attack took place in Pakistan, gave medals and awards to honour valour and bravery of police officials for fighting the terrorists during the attack.[http://www.app.com.pk/en_/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=70205&Itemid=2 "Gallantry medals given to valiant police officials"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090827090514/http://www.app.com.pk/en_/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=70205&Itemid=2 |date=27 August 2009 }}, [[Associated Press of Pakistan]]. ==Aftermath== Insurance costs for cricket matches in India, Pakistan, Bangladesh and Sri Lanka rose.Mayur Shetty (4 March 2009), "[http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/Lahore-attack-Terror-cover-to-cost-more/articleshow/4220745.cms Lahore attack: Terror cover to cost more for IPL franchisees]". ''Economic Times''. The [[New Zealand national cricket team|New Zealand]] team cancelled its December 2009 tour of Pakistan.[http://content-www.cricinfo.com/pakistan/content/current/story/393259.html "Pakistan's World Cup hopes under threat"]. Cricinfo. [[Bangladesh]] also put off a scheduled tour by Pakistan to Bangladesh."[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/cricket/7925471.stm Pakistan's tour of Bangladesh off]". [[BBC News]], 2009-03-05. The Union Home Minister of India, [[P. Chidambaram]], said that the [[Indian Premier League]] should consider postponing the forthcoming [[Twenty20|T20]] league matches due to be held over 45 days from 10 April to 24 May 2009 in 9 Indian cities, since in the light of these attacks, security forces would be stretched too thin between the league matches and the five phases of the [[Indian general election, 2009|forthcoming general elections]] in India.{{cite news|url=http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/001200903032187.htm |title=PC suggests postponement of T-20 tournament |work=The Hindu |date=3 March 2009 |accessdate=2009-03-04 |location=Chennai, India |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121103230008/http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/001200903032187.htm |archivedate=3 November 2012 |df= }} The elections were slated to be held between 16 April and 13 May and it was impossible to reschedule them while IPL organizers appeared to be unwilling to postpone the tournament.{{cite news |url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1090304/jsp/frontpage/story_10621948.jsp |title=IPL resists govt pressure to postpone spectacle |work=The Telegraph |date=4 March 2009 |accessdate=2009-03-04 |location=Calcutta, India| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090306205007/http://telegraphindia.com/1090304/jsp/frontpage/story_10621948.jsp| archivedate= 6 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} Former [[England national cricket team|England]] coach [[Duncan Fletcher]] said that English players contracted to the IPL would now be more concerned for their safety.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/sport/blog/2009/mar/04/duncan-fletcher-sri-lanka-lahore-attack |title=England stars must think again about playing in the IPL |author=Duncan Fletcher |work=TheSportsBlog |date=4 March 2009 |accessdate=2009-03-04 |location=London| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090305074410/http://www.guardian.co.uk/sport/blog/2009/mar/04/duncan-fletcher-sri-lanka-lahore-attack| archivedate= 5 March 2009 | deadurl= no}} The [[2009 Indian Premier League]] was hosted by South Africa between 18 April and 24 May 2009. Former Indian captain [[Sourav Ganguly]] said after these attacks Pakistan not a safe venue to play cricket."[http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2009-03-08/patna/28053087_1_cricket-team-new-zealander-john-wright-south-african-gary-kirsten Pak not a safe venue for playing cricket: Ganguly]". ''[[The Times of India]]'', 2009-03-08. The [[2011 Cricket World Cup]] was to be co-hosted by [[Pakistan]], [[India]], [[Sri Lanka]] and [[Bangladesh]], but in the wake of this attack on the [[Sri Lanka national cricket team|Sri Lankan cricket team]] the [[International Cricket Council]] (ICC) stripped Pakistan of its hosting rights due to security concerns.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/cricket/other_international/pakistan/8004684.stm |title=No World Cup matches in Pakistan |publisher=BBC |accessdate=2009-04-17 |date=18 April 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090418013231/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/cricket/other_international/pakistan/8004684.stm| archivedate= 18 April 2009 | deadurl= no}} The headquarters of the organising committee were originally situated in Lahore, but was then shifted to Mumbai.{{cite web |url=http://content.cricinfo.com/india/content/current/story/401726.html |title=World Cup shifts base from Lahore to Mumbai |publisher=Cricinfo |accessdate=2009-04-17| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090430031240/http://content.cricinfo.com/india/content/current/story/401726.html| archivedate= 30 April 2009 | deadurl= no}} Pakistan was supposed to hold 14 matches, including one semi-final.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/cricket/other_international/pakistan/8004684.stm |title=Pakistan counts cost of Cup shift |publisher=BBC |accessdate=2009-04-18 |date=18 April 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090418013231/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/cricket/other_international/pakistan/8004684.stm| archivedate= 18 April 2009 | deadurl= no}} Eight of Pakistan's matches were awarded to India, four to Sri Lanka and two to Bangladesh.{{cite web |url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5gjlcwb7FGlFoUn2QjftFetKAeYOQ |title=Pakistan nears solution to World Cup dispute |publisher=AFP |accessdate=2009-07-31}} The Sri Lankan Foreign minister has said the Sri Lankan cricket team "will give highest consideration to the invitation extended to it to undertake visit again. Sri Lanka will not allow Pakistan's isolation in cricket." In October 2017, the Sri Lankan cricket team [[Sri Lankan cricket team against Pakistan in the UAE in 2017–18#3rd T20I|returned to Pakistan]] for the first time since the attack to play a [[Twenty20 International]] match at the Gaddafi Stadium.{{cite web |url=http://www.espncricinfo.com/series/18037/preview/1120293/ |title=Lahore readies itself for that international feeling |accessdate=29 October 2017 |work=ESPN Cricinfo}} ==See also== {{wikinews|Seven killed in gun attack on Sri Lankan cricket team}} * [[Attack on Pakistani ambassador to Sri Lanka]] * [[2010 Togo national football team bus attack]] * [[List of terrorist incidents in Pakistan since 2001]] * [[Sri Lankan cricket team in Pakistan in 2008–09]] * [[Terrorism in Pakistan]] ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== *[https://www.theguardian.com/world/sri-lanka-cricket-team-attack The Guardian's portal on the attack] *[http://english.aljazeera.net/sport/2009/03/20093121222845373.html New captain Sangakkara interviewed after the attack] {{Cricket in Sri Lanka}} {{International cricket tours of Pakistan}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sri Lanka national cricket team attack}} [[Category:2009 in Sri Lankan cricket]] [[Category:Mass murder in 2009]] [[Category:Terrorist incidents in Pakistan in 2009]] [[Category:History of Pakistani cricket]] [[Category:History of Sri Lankan cricket]] [[Category:Pakistan–Sri Lanka relations]] [[Category:Terrorist incidents on buses]] [[Category:Mass shootings]] [[Category:Terrorist incidents in Lahore]] [[Category:Deaths by firearm in Pakistan]] [[Category:Violence in sports]] [[Category:Lashkar-e-Jhangvi attacks]] [[Category:Islamic terrorist incidents in the 2000s]] [[Category:Gaddafi Stadium]] [[Category:Accidents and incidents involving sports teams]] [[Category:Cricket tours abandoned due to terrorism]]

page.title: 2012 Boca del Río murder of journalists

revision.comment: link [[safety of journalists]] using [[:en:User:Edward/Find link|Find link]]
revision.text: {{WAP assignment | course = Wikipedia:USEP/Courses/Introduction to Mass Communications (Chad Tew) | university = University of Southern Indiana | term = 2012 Q3 | project = WikiProject Journalism}} {{Infobox civilian attack | title = 2012 Veracruz murder of journalists | partof = [[Mexican Drug War]] | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | map ={{Location map | Mexico Veracruz | float = center | caption = | alt = Boca del Río, is in Veracruz state, Mexico | label = Boca del Río, Veracruz | lat_deg = 19 | lat_min = 06 | lat_sec =20 | lat_dir = N | lon_deg = 96 | lon_min = 06 | lon_sec =28 | lon_dir = W }} | map_size = | map_alt = | map_caption = | location = Boca Del Río, Veracruz, Mexico | target = | coordinates = 19°06′20″N 96°06′28″W | date = 3 May 2012 | time = | timezone = | type = Murder | fatalities = 4 | injuries = | victim = Guillermo Luna Varela, Gabriel Huge Córdoba, Esteban Rodríguez Rodríguez, Ana Irasema Becerra Jiménez | perps = | perp = | perpetrators= | perpetrator = | susperps = | susperp = | weapons = | numparts = | numpart = | dfens = | dfen = | footage = | motive = }} {{Campaignbox Mexican Drug War}} The '''2012 Veracruz murder of journalists''' is about the disappearance, murder and dismemberment of three journalists and a woman who worked in public relations whose bodies were discovered in [[Boca del Río, Veracruz|Boca del Río]], [[Veracruz]], [[Mexico]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-latin-america-17945766 |title=BBC News - Mexico violence: Two journalists killed in Veracruz |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date=2012-05-03 |accessdate=2012-10-17}}{{cite web|url=http://es.rsf.org/mexico-la-revista-proceso-esta-de-duelo-30-04-2012,42405.html |title=Asesinan a otros dos periodistas en Veracruz, una semana después del homicidio de Regina Martínez |publisher=Reporteros sin fronteras |date=2012-04-30 |accessdate=2012-10-17}} Their bodies were recovered from a canal on [[World Press Freedom Day]], or 3 May 2012, and showed signs of torture and mutilation, which prompted calls for investigations into links with organized crime. The gruesome murder followed other murders of members of the press in the Veracruz area and during the [[Mexican Drug War]], and highlighted the danger for working journalists.{{cite web|url=http://www.vanguardia.com.mx/asesinanaunreporteroydosfotografosenveracruz-1278955.html |title=Asesinan a un reportero y dos fotógrafos en Veracruz |publisher=Vanguardia |date= |accessdate=2012-10-17}} == Background == El Programa de Agravios a Periodistas y Defensores Civiles reported 580 incidents affecting the media from 2005 to May 2012, including 79 homicides, 14 missing journalists, and 26 recorded threats.{{cite web|url=http://www.eluniversal.com.mx/estados/85690.html |title=Los Estados - Matan en Veracruz a tres fotorreporteros |publisher=El Universal |date=2012-05-04 |accessdate=2012-10-17}} The number of reported incidents in Mexico has steadily increased over past years, reaching number eight in the [[Committee to Protect Journalists|Committee to Protect Journalists']](CPJ) impunity index.{{cite web|url=http://cpj.org/reports/2012/04/impunity-index-2012.php |title=Getting Away With Murder|publisher=Committee to Protect Journalists |date=2012-04-17 |accessdate=2012-12-02}} Veracruz is well known for the Sinaloa and Zetas drug cartels. These two cartels fight for control of Boca del Río, Veracruz, making it one of the most dangerous Mexican states for the press. In a year and a half, six journalists were reported dead from this area.{{cite news|author=Source: Unescopress |url=http://www.unesco.org/new/en/media-services/single-view/news/director_general_alarmed_by_wave_of_journalist_assassinations_in_mexico_and_calls_for_urgent_investigation/ |title=Director-General alarmed by wave of journalist assassinations in Mexico and calls for urgent investigation | United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization |publisher=Unesco.org |date= |accessdate=2012-10-17}} The murders of Luna, Huge, Rodríguez, and Becerra brought the total to ten reported deaths. == Incident == {{Location map+|Mexico|width=300|float=left |AlternativeMap = Mexico States blank map.svg |caption= Guillermo Luna Varela worked for ''Notiver'' in Veracruz, Veracruz and was colleagues with two other murdered journalists, Miguel Ángel López Velasco and Yolanda Ordaz de la Cruz. |places= {{Location map~ | Mexico |lat_deg=19 |lat_min=11 |lat_dir=N |lon_deg=96 |lon_min=09 |lon_dir=W |position=bottom |background=#FFFFFF |label=Veracruz }} {{Location map~ | Mexico |lat_deg=19 |lat_min=25 |lat_sec=57 |lat_dir=N |lon_deg=99 |lon_min=07 |lon_sec=59 |lon_dir=W |position=left |background=#FFFFFF |label=Mexico City }} }}On World Press Freedom Day, the bodies of Guillermo Luna Varela, Gabriel Huge Córdova, and Esteban Rodríguez, three photojournalists, were recovered from La Zamorana canal in Boca del Río. After not returning from covering a road incident, the families of Guillermo Luna and Gabriel Huge reported them missing.{{cite web|url=http://www.ifex.org/mexico/2012/05/04/photographers_killed/ |title=Three photojournalists found dead in Veracruz |publisher=IFEX |date= |accessdate=2012-10-17}} Police found the dismembered bodies of Luna and Huge in a black plastic bag. They also recovered the bodies of Rodríguez and Irasema Becerra. Becerra and Luna were in a relationship, and she worked for a local newspaper firm. == Journalists involved == ===Guillermo Luna Varela=== Luna was a photographer who worked for ''Notiver'' and covered police-related stories. Six months prior to his death, he worked for the website ''Veracruznews'', Voz del Sureste, and El Díario de Cardel. His police beat was in [[Xalapa]] and Boca del Río in Veracruz. His body was found in Boca del Río alongside his uncle, Huge, and also showed signs of torture. Luna was reported missing a day earlier by his family after not returning from covering a road accident.{{cite web|author=Guillermo Luna Varela |url=http://cpj.org/killed/2012/guillermo-luna-varela.php |title=Guillermo Luna Varela - Journalists Killed - Committee to Protect Journalists |publisher=Cpj.org |date= |accessdate=2012-10-17}} ===Gabriel Huge Córdoba=== Huge's body displayed signs of torture and was found in a black bag with Luna, his nephew. He worked at ''Notiver'' as a photographer and he also worked for a radio station in Poza Rica. After three journalists of ''The Notiver'' were murdered the previous year, Huge fled from the city. When he returned, he worked as a freelancer. He disappeared on a Wednesday with Luna while covering a traffic incident.{{cite web|url=http://cpj.org/killed/2012/gabriel-huge-cordova.php |title=Gabriel Huge Córdova - Journalists Killed |publisher=Committee to Protect Journalists |date=2012-05-04 |accessdate=2012-10-17}} ===Esteban Rodríguez Rodríguez=== Rodríguez was a retired photojournalist and reporter who worked for the ''Diario AZ''. He became a welder after his retirement. After the murder of fellow journalists at ''The Notiver'', Rodríguez temporarily fled the state and retired, returning to Veracruz to work as a welder. ===Ana Irasema Becerra Jiménez=== A fourth body was later identified as Becerra, Luna's companion. While she was not a journalist, she worked for a local paper in public relations. == Investigation == On Monday, 13 August, the [[Mexican Navy]] began to crack the case. "The Mexican Navy announced Monday that a man suspected of being a member of a drug gang had been captured while carrying the identification cards of a recently slain newspaper employee in the state of Veracruz. The authorities link the suspect, Juan Carlos Hernández Pulido, whom they captured Friday, to the killing of the newspaper employee, Irasema Becerra. Her dismembered remains were found in May along with those of three photojournalists."{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-latin-america-19250974 |title=BBC News - Mexico navy arrests suspect over killing of journalists |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date=2012-08-13 |accessdate=2012-10-17}}{{cite web|last=Zabludovsky |first=Karla |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/08/14/world/americas/suspected-drug-gang-member-linked-to-veracruz-killings.html |title=Suspected Drug Gang Member Linked to Veracruz Killings |location=Veracruz (Mexico) |publisher=NYTimes.com |date=2012-08-13 |accessdate=2012-11-14}} Authorities searched the vehicle of Hernández, also known as "Bertha", when a suspicious individual was reported in a parking lot. In his vehicle, they found more than 150 bags of cocaine and marijuana, which he sold alongside illegal firearms. They also found documents and an ID belonging to Becerra, linking him to the Boca Del Rio homicide. He is accused of working for the Jalisco drug cartel as a hired murderer. Hernández was not working alone. Veracruz authorities closed the case 15 August and claimed members of a drug gang confessed to the murders. Some uncertainty about the finality of the case was presented. "But as soon as the arrests were announced on Wednesday, questions began to surface, beginning with the most obvious one. Why would the seven suspects, picked up on drug and weapons charges, spontaneously admit to far more serious crimes, in this case four brutal killings?"{{cite web|last=Malkin |first=Elisabeth |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/08/17/world/americas/skepticism-greets-arrests-in-murders-of-mexican-journalists.html |title=Skepticism Greets Arrests in Murders of Mexican Journalists |location=Mexico;Veracruz (Mexico) |publisher=NYTimes.com |date=2012-08-16 |accessdate=2012-11-14}}{{cite news|author=Tracy Wilkinson|url=http://www.latimes.com/news/nationworld/world/la-fg-mexico-journalists-20120817,0,3054999.story |title=Mexico journalists' killings solved? Critics doubt it - Los Angeles Times |publisher= Los Angeles Times|date=2012-08-17 |accessdate=2012-10-17 }} Nine journalists in the last 18 months have focused attention on the investigations in Veracruz. Further investigation, along with coincidence, linked several other cases of homicide among journalists and their families. These linked cases are not linked to the Veracruz murder by perpetrator, but by similarities in the brutality of the homicides. The following are related homicide cases: * [[Regina Martínez Pérez]], journalist found strangled in her home in Xalapa, Veracruz on 28 April, Saturday. She was considered a muckraker on drug cartels and worked as a correspondent for the magazine Proceso. * [[Yolanda Ordaz de la Cruz]], partner reporter to Córdova, found decapitated after her abduction by armed men outside her house. A note was found on her body, further linking her to Miguel Ángel López Velasco.{{cite web|author=Journalist found decapitated in Mexico |url=http://cpj.org/2011/07/journalist-found-decapitated-in-mexico.php |title=Journalist found decapitated in Mexico - Committee to Protect Journalists |publisher=Cpj.org |date=2011-07-26 |accessdate=2012-10-17}} * [[Miguel Ángel López Velasco]], a columnist, was murdered alongside his wife and son, a photographer, and found on 20 June. A traffic cop, Juan Carlos Carranza Saavedra, was a suspect in their deaths. == Impact == The murders of Luna, Huge, Rodríguez and Becerra heightened awareness of the dangers for journalists in the Veracruz area. Officials and organizations recognize the need to combat the violence of growing drug cartels. Efforts are made to further increase awareness, especially with outrage from UNESCO, Article 19, and other groups focused on the rights and [[safety of journalists]]. == Reactions == [[Irina Bokova]], director-general of [[UNESCO]], expressed her concerned about the deaths of journalists in the Veracruz area. "News of the murders of Gabriel Huge and Guillermo Luna Varela – tortured and killed less than one week after the assassination of Regina Martínez Pérez – is deeply disturbing, and reflects an alarming state of affairs in the state of Veracruz," she said. The bodies of the Boca Del Rio journalists were found nearing World Press Freedom Day. Bokova said, “That these gruesome crimes have been committed on the eve of World Press Freedom Day – a day on which we honour the vital role played by journalists in upholding democratic values, protecting citizens’ rights to be informed and calling those in power to account – makes the situation all the more intolerable." Bokova continued in the statement to say, “I condemn these three murders in the strongest possible terms and urge the Mexican authorities to act quickly and decisively to find those responsible. Impunity is not an option." [[Article 19]], a group focused on the freedom of expression and information, expressed their outrage of the Boca del Rio incident, "--the Mexican authorities have consistently failed to fulfill their international obligations to guarantee the free exercise of freedom of expression and the mechanisms currently in place do not address the central problem, which is the impunity that follows these crimes." They also said the authorities of Veracruz did not take the necessary steps in resolving the case. ==See also== * [[Mexican Drug War]] * [[List of journalists killed in Mexico]] * [[Humberto Millán Salazar]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Mexican Drug War}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Veracruz massacre}} [[Category:Massacres in Mexico]] [[Category:Articles created via the Article Wizard]] [[Category:Mass murder in 2012]] [[Category:Deaths by firearm in Mexico]] [[Category:Deaths by dismemberment]] [[Category:Assassinated Mexican journalists]] [[Category:Journalists killed in the Mexican Drug War]] [[Category:2012 crimes in Mexico]] [[Category:May 2012 events]]
